description: From Arabic غَوَازٍ‎ (ḡawāzin), the plural of غَازِيَة‎ (ḡāziya), the feminine of غَازٍ‎ (ḡāzin, “ghazi, raider, aggressor, conqueror”). The dancers were so called because they were said to "conquer" the hearts of their audience.

entries.meaning: A type of female dancer popular in Egypt in the 19th century, who danced in a style similar to the belly dance.
